page.title: 15Education
page.content: The area is well equipped with a range of schools giving free and compulsory education for all children, from the age of 5 to 16 years. There are 2 infant schools for children of 5/7 years of age, 3 junior schools for children of 7/11 years of age and 3 primary schools for children from 5/11 (including one Roman Catholic Primary School). Children from 11/16 have a choice of 4 Secondary Schools (including l Roman Catholic School). There is a College of Further Education, offering full and part-time study for school leavers, and a special school for the Mentally and Physically Disabled children. The area also offers evening classes in both practical and academic subjects and 2 county nurseries and l private nursery, for pre-school children. There is also a Teachers' Centre.
